doc:
Hugh Paddick https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hugh_Paddick 0 Hugh William Paddick (22 August 1915 – 9 November 2000) was an English actor, whose most notable role was in the 1960s BBC radio show Round the Horne, in sketches such as "Charles and Fiona" (as Charles) and "Julian and Sandy" (as Julian). Both he and Kenneth Williams are largely responsible for introducing the underground language polari to the British public.Paddick also enjoyed success as Percival Browne in the original West End production of The Boy Friend, in 1954. Hugh_William_Paddick ( 22_August_1915 – 9_November_2000 ) was an_English_actor , whose_most_notable_role was in the_1960s_BBC_radio_show Round the_Horne , in sketches such_as " Charles_and_Fiona " ( as Charles ) and " Julian_and_Sandy " ( as Julian ) . Both he and Kenneth_Williams are largely_responsible for introducing the_underground_language_polari to the_British_public.Paddick also enjoyed success as Percival_Browne in the_original_West_End_production of The_Boy_Friend , in 1954 .
